page.title: 16MARKET HISTORY
page.content: The market was started in 1286 by a charter granted by Edward to the Monks of Burscough Priory. After the dissolution of the monastries the charter was granted to the Earl of Derby and it was not until 1876 that the people of the town bought the rites to the market. It was an agricultural market where livestock and produce were sold. Traders came from the surrounding villages. Cattle and sheep were driven by a drover with the help of a little black and tan dog, an Ormskirk Heeler. Butchers slaughtered animals in the street. An American tourist in 1850 said" The market is overcrowded dirty, noisy and smelly but the people are pleasant". Today, there are still problems of litter and overcrowding but the people are still pleasant.
